text: {{Infobox dog breed |name = Aidi |image = Aidi.jpg |image_alt = Aidi image |image_caption = White Aidi |altname = AÃ¯di Atlas Mountain Dog Atlas Shepherd Dog Berber Dog Chien de l'Atlas Chien de montagne de l'Atlas |country = Morocco |collapse_standards_and_traits = yes |weight = |maleweight = |femaleweight = |height = |maleheight = |femaleheight = |coat = Thick, medium-length |color = Black, brown, brindle, cream or cream sable, or red or red sable, all with or without black mask or any amount of white |litter_size = |life_span = |fcistd = http://www.fci.be/Nomenclature/Standards/247g02-en.pdf |note = }} The Aidi or Chien de l'Atlas is a Moroccan dog breed used to protect flocks of sheep and goats. It also can hunt and smell very well. In its native Morocco it is often paired in hunting with the Sloughi, which chases down prey that the Aidi has found by sniffing it out. == Other websites == * Breed Details from THE AMERICAN RARE BREED ASSOCIATION Category:Dog breeds Category:FCI breeds Category:Working dogs
title: Aidi
